item.title: Report X-2023120954
item.description:
Report X-2023120954

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-18
  • City: HAMMOND
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120954 SequenceEvent: Upon walking to a load door, a hazmat package was discovered damaged. Hazmat drum was receive from the cage and hazmat was place inside the drum. All materials was placed in drum and area cleaned. There was no one present, therefor the area did not need to be blocked off. DescribePack: Package was wet and contents within the package was damaged. The bottles of the container was cracked. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was picked up from the area and placed in hazmat drum. neutralizer was placed on the area of the spill. 2. X-2023120964 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY LOAD DOOR WITH INTERNAL LEAKAGE. HAZMAT DRUM WAS RETRIEVED AND PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN DRUM. AREA WAS NOT BLOCKED BECAUSE THERE WERE NO PEOPLE PRESENT. AREA WAS CLEANED WITH HAZMAT SUPPLIED AND CLEARED. DescribePack: BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE WAS COMPLETELY SOAKED. UPON OPENING PACKAGE, CAPS WAS LEAKING AND THE BODY WAS CRACKED. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED QUICKLY IN A HAZMAT DRUM AND AREA CLEANED.

item.title: Report I-2023100027
item.description:
Report I-2023100027

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T00:33:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-16
  • City: CRAWFORDSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DOUBLE J TRANSPORT INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Tuesday, May 16, 2023 at 11:48am, I (Deputy Anthony Teal #5421} responded to a personal injury crash on Interstate 74, westbound at the 34 MM. At the time of the crash the weather was clear and the road surface was dry. The driver (Michael Pender} of Vehicle #1 (white 2001 International 9100i, IN tag 3076627) advised he was traveling west on Interstate 74 pulling a tank trailer (IN tag SP698LBD} when he noticed vehicles slowing in front of him due to a traffic back up on the interstate offramp (roadWay construction on US Route 231 }. According to Michael, he felt like he had no where else to go but into the guardrail because another semi-trailer truck was blocking the left lane (passing lane). Michael's semi tractor and tank trailer struck the guardrail on the north side of the highway, overturned, and rolled down an embankment coming to rest on its passenger side. The tank trailer was carrying approximately 7,000-gallons of gasoline and 1,000-gallons of diesel fuel. The crash created a leak in the tanker that was carrying gasoline. Once the Crawfordsville Fire Department (CFO} arrived they were able stop the leak and contain the spill. Montgomery County Emergency Management (EMA} was contacted and arrived on scene to assist with the spill. Ultimately, a secondary tanker was brought to the scene by Bowman's (Brownsburg, IN} to offload the flammable liquids. The westbound lanes of Interstate 74 were closed for a period of time because of the accident. The wrecked semi tractor and tank trailer were recovered from the ditch by Wilson's Towing. Driver Michael Pender appeared to be disoriented at the scene due to a head injury. He was able to self-extricate from his semi, but complained of pain to his head and was treated by Crawfordsville Fire Department Medics. Medics then transported him to Franciscan Hospital by ambulance (#4155 ). Indiana State Police (ISP) Commercial Vehicle Enforcement Division arrived on scene and performed a vehicle inspection on Vehicle #1. Witness Catherine Crosby stopped at the accident scene and provided a statement Catherine said she was driving west on Interstate 7 4 in the right lane (slow lane} when she observed two semi trucks in front of her occupying the left and right lanes. She stated that traffic in front of the semi trucks began to slow. She then saw the semi tractor with the tank trailer drive off the roadway, strike the guardrail, overturn three times, and end up at the bottom of an embankment. I inquired if she noticed anything about the driver of the semi. Catherine said nothing other than he appeared to have a head injury.

item.title: Report I-2023090117
item.description:
Report I-2023090117

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-31T00:35:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: JEFFERSONVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Univar Solutions USA Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver arrived at customer to fill a sulfuric tank. He verified the tank, quantity, product, and connections before starting to pump. The driver started the pump and after a couple of minutes he noticed sulfuric acid leaking out of the pump box. The driver immediately shut it down and notified his supervisor. The customer blocked off the nearest sewer drain with boom and absorbent. A third party cleanup contractor was sent in to neutralize and remove the product that was released. The cause of the release was determined to be two loose nuts on the flange that connects the outbound side of the pump to the hose reel. Going forward we will be checking the torque on all nuts inside this pump box monthly.
